titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Under the terms of the 1794 Treaty of Amity, Commerce, and Navigation between Great Britain and the United States, Jay's Treaty, a board of commissioners was appointed to evaluate Amerian spoilation claims against Britain, provided for by Article Seven of the treaty. This volume contains fifity nine of the reports (#120, 1798 to #225, 1802 broken series) prepared by the Commissioners' Assessors, Samuel Cabot, Alexander Glennie, and Martin Petrie, meeting in London. They list the name of the American vessel, its master, destination, value of cargoes, costs, and insurance compensation, if any and memoranda of decisions by the Board.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
